modules.description: Provides functions to handle Ethernet communication, including writing frames with source and destination MAC addresses, specifying protocol types, and managing payload data. Processes incoming packets by demultiplexing based on protocol and delivers them to appropriate handlers. Exposes methods to retrieve the MAC address and MTU of the interface.

Handles ARP request and response message parsing, construction, and validation using IPv4 addresses and Ethernet MAC addresses. Processes raw Ethernet frames to extract and generate ARP payloads for network communication. Used in network stack implementations to map IP addresses to physical network interfaces.

Handles Ethernet frame transmission and reception, enabling the construction of frames with custom MAC addresses, protocol types, and payloads, while also processing incoming packets by protocol. Supports retrieval of interface-specific data such as MAC address and MTU. Allows for sending raw frames, parsing received data, and routing packets to protocol-specific handlers. Example tasks include crafting custom Ethernet packets, inspecting incoming traffic, and interfacing with higher-layer protocols like ARP or IP.
